text: The Cook Islands women's national football team represents Cook Islands in international women's football. The team is controlled by the Cook Islands Football Association. With a population of around 18,000 people it remains one of the smallest FIFA teams. Cook Islands never qualified for a FIFA Women's World Cup, but entered the OFC Women's Nations Cup four times, in 2003, 2010, 2014 and 2018. ==History== ===Beginnings=== The Cook Islands women's national team played its first international match... ===–present=== ==Home stadium== The Cook Islands women's national team play their home matches on... ==Kits== ==Achievements== ===World Cup record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: center;" |- !Year !Result !Matches !Wins !Draws !Losses !GF !GA |- | 1991 |colspan=8|Did Not Enter |- | 1995 |colspan=8|Did Not Enter |- | 1999 |colspan=8|Did Not Enter |- | 2003 |colspan=8|Did Not Qualify |- | 2007 |colspan=8|Did Not Enter |- | 2011 |colspan=8|Did Not Qualify |- | 2015 |colspan=8|Did Not Qualify |- | 2019 |colspan=8|Did Not Qualify |- | 2023 |colspan=8|To Be Determined |- |Total||0/9||0||0||0||0||0||0 |} ===OFC Women's Championship record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width:50%;" |- !colspan=10|Oceania Women's Cup |- !Year !Result !GP !W !D* !L !GF !GA !GD |- |- | 1983||Did Not Enter||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- | 1986||Did Not Enter||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- | 1989||Did Not Enter||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- | 1991||Did Not Enter||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- | 1994||Did Not Enter||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- | 1998||Did Not Enter||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- | 2003||Group Stage||4||0||0||4||1||26||−25 |- | 2007||Did Not Enter||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |-bgcolor=cfaa88 | 2010||Third Place||5||3||0||2||5||11||−6 |-bgcolor=cfaa88 | 2014||Third Place||3||0||1||2||2||16||−14 |- | 2018||Group Stage||3||0||0||3||0||10||−10 |- | 2022||colspan=8|To Be Determined |- |Total||3/10||15||3||1||11||8||63||−55 |} :*Draws include knockout matches decided on penalty kicks. ==Players== ===Current Squad=== The following players were called up for the 2019 Pacific Games from 7–20 July in Apia, Samoa. Caps and goals updated as of 20 July 2019, after the game against Fiji. ===Recent call-ups=== The following players have been called up for the team in the last 12 months. ==Results and fixtures== The following is a list of match results in the last 12 months, as well as any future matches that have been scheduled. ==See also== * Cook Islands national football team * Cook Islands national under-20 football team * Cook Islands national under-17 football team * Cook Islands women's national under-17 football team ==References== ==External links== * Official website * FIFA profile Category:Oceanian women's national association football teams Category:Football in the Cook Islands Category:Cook Islands women's national football team
